settings.text: Australia's most trusted kids electric scooter brand

settings.content: Explore expertly crafted e-scooter parts and accessories designed to elevate every ride

settings.title: Do you offer test rides for kids scooters?
settings.content: Yes! We offer free in-store test rides for all our kids electric scooters at our Boronia warehouse. Bring the little ones along and we'll set them up on a demo ride in a safe, supervised area.

settings.title: Do you provide after-sales support for kids scooters?
settings.content: Absolutely. We offer lifetime support on every purchase, even for our children's models. At The Simple Commute, exceptional service for our young riders (and their parents) is how we do business.

settings.title: What are the benefits of kids electric scooters?
settings.content:
Kids electric scooters offer fun, independence and a gentle introduction to e-mobility. At The Simple Commute, our children's scooters feature:

  • Speed Limiters: Safe top speeds tailored for younger riders.
  • Lightweight Frames: Easy for kids to handle and carry.
  • Stable Design: Wider decks and low centers of gravity for balance.
  • Long-Lasting Batteries: Up to 15 km range for park runs and short commutes.
  • Bright LEDs & Brakes: Built-in lights and reliable braking for safety.

They're the perfect way for kids to build coordination and confidence outdoors.

settings.title: How do I choose the right kids electric scooter?
settings.content:
When selecting a scooter for your child, consider:

  • Age & Height: Check the recommended age/height range.
  • Speed Control: Look for adjustable limiters.
  • Weight Capacity: Ensure it supports your child's weight plus any gear.
  • Battery Range: Aim for at least 10–15 km per charge.
  • Portability: A lighter model makes it easier for kids to carry.

Choosing the right specs ensures a safe, enjoyable ride every time.

settings.title: Are kids electric scooters legal in Australia?
settings.content: Regulations vary by state and territory. In many areas, kids scooters are treated like bikes on paths—helmets required and speed limits enforced. We recommend checking your local council rules before riding. Our models comply with all Australian safety standards.

settings.title: How long does a kids scooter battery last?
settings.content:
Battery life depends on model and usage. On average our children's scooters deliver:

  • Range: 10–15 km on a full charge.
  • Factors: Rider weight, terrain and speed affect runtime.
  • Care Tips: Avoid full discharges and charge regularly to prolong battery health.

For exact figures, see the specs on each product page or contact our team.

settings.title: Frequently asked questions
